page.title: 11Farming, Rangeworthy
page.content: {In this area, the farmland}is mostly pasture on which are kept sheep, milking cows and a few beef cattle. {The farms are of medium to small size, ranging from 250 hectares down to 19 hectares which is the size of the smallest farm we recorded. {This is how a local farmworker described his work. On his farm, there are 3 full time workers for a farm of 250 hectares. They use lots of machinery, for example:tractors, a plough, a combine harvester, a sprayer, a mower, a bailer, a "muck spreader" and milking equipment. {The livestock}consists of sheep, cows and beef cattle. To feed them they use hay, barley, oats and artificial foodstuffs. {The busiest time}is from May through to September, particularly June and July, when there is haymaking.
